line_1: The Mocking-bird his varying note essays,
line_2: And charms the grove with imitative lays;

line_1: Ev'n mine, a bashful Muse, whose rude essays
line_2: Scarce hope for pardon, not aspire to praise,

line_1: And all the Muses dance to HADDINGTONS Essays;
line_2: The God of Musick joins when COLVIL plays,

line_1: Ah, shield from it's lash every bard, who essays
line_2: To solicit your favour and merit the bays;
